sentence.Network_en: "I want to send a telegram." — "Fine, to whom?"
Soldiers took away four people one of whom was later released.
sentence.Network_cn: 士兵们抓走4个人，其中1个随后被放了回来。

sentence.Network_en: Elizabeth met other Oxford intellectuals some of whom overlapped Naomi's world.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊丽莎白结识了其他一些牛津大学的学者，其中有几位娜奥米也认识。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 表示“谁(who),谁 (whom),谁的(whose),什么(what), 哪个或哪些 (which)”等词叫疑问代词。　　疑问代词的用法:　　疑问代词用于特殊疑问.
特殊疑问句_百度百科 ... whose（ 谁的，指附属关系） whom（ 谁，作宾语） when（ 何时，询问时间）.
英语语法入门：初级_百度文库 ... ） whichever 任何一个、任何一些（相当于 ） whom 指人（宾格） ） where ?? 的地方（相当于.
谁有英语常用语法?_百度知道 ... who 人 whom 人 whose 人 / 物.

list.abs: ...耶稣所爱的门徒（ο μαθητης ον ηγαπα ο Ιησους, o mathētēs on ēgapa o Iēsous，disciple whom Jesus loved），或是门徒、爱徒（ον εφιλει ο Ιησους, on ephilei o Iēsous，Beloved Disciple），出现于《约翰福音》之中，但是在约翰福音中，并没有明确写出这位门徒的身份。这是约.
经济学英语词汇 - 豆丁网 ... fluctuation 波动 for whom to produce 为谁生产 free entry 自由进入.

entry.tran: (用于疑问句，询问人的姓名或身份)谁
entry.def: You use whom in questions when you ask about the name or identity of a person or group of people.

example.ex: 'I want to send a telegram.' — 'Fine, to whom?'...
Whom did he expect to answer his phone?...

entry.tran: (尤用于某些动词和形容词后，引导谈论某人或某一群人的姓名或身份的从句)谁
entry.def: You use whom after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause where you talk about the name or identity of a person or a group of people.

example.ex: He asked whom I'd told about his having been away...
example.tran: 他问我把他曾离开的消息告诉过谁。

example.ex: He likes to know whom you've met...

entry.tran: (用于进行限定说明或提供更多信息的关系从句的句首)
entry.def: You use whom at the beginning of a relative clause when specifying the person or group of people you are talking about or when giving more information about them.

example.ex: One writer in whom I had taken an interest was Immanuel Velikovsky...
example.tran: 我感兴趣的其中一位作家是伊曼纽尔·韦利科夫斯基。

example.ex: The Homewood residents whom I knew had little money and little free time.
example.tran: 我所认识的霍姆伍德的居民没多少钱也没多少闲暇时间。

auth_sentence.content: We don't know whom to call as witnesses.
auth_sentence.res_content: We don't know whom to call as witnesses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We don't know whom to call as witnesses.

auth_sentence.content: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?
auth_sentence.res_content: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The man to whom Prime Ministers bend the knee?

auth_sentence.content: It was someone whom he had met years ago.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was someone whom he had met years ago.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was someone whom he had met years ago.

Sentence.sentence: Reasonable people may disagree about whom to blame.
Next, consider eBay, Having started out as a peer-to-peer marketplace, it is now dominated by professional "power sellers" ( many of whom started out as ordinary eBay users)
When I look at my friendship with Joe, I wonder how many people I've known whom I never disliked, but simply didn't take the time to get to know.

means.word_mean: (who的宾格,作为动词或介词的宾语)谁,什么人

sentences.en: To whom did you give the book?
These new neighbours, to whom I was introduced yesterday, have come here from Singapore.
sentences.cn: 这些新邻居是从新加坡来的, 昨天我被介绍同他们认识了。

sentences.en: I don't know whom to give it to.
He is the man (whom) they understood to be extremely rich.
sentences.cn: 他就是那个他们认为腰缠万贯的人。

jushi.english: He is the man (whom) they understood to be extremely rich.
jushi.chinese: 他就是那个他们认为腰缠万贯的人。

jushi.english: To whom did you give the book?
The man whom〔that, who〕 I saw is called Smith.
jushi.chinese: 我见到的那个人叫史密斯。
